movies.title: Stand Your Ground
movies.plot: When Jackie Carpenter's (Francine Locke) son, Jason (Drew Matthews), is accused of murder she fights against the odds to free him; but when the prosecution (Sandra W. Van Natta) seeks a life sentence, both Jackie's and Jason's world spins into turmoil sending them on parallel journeys of wavering faith and tentative hope. STAND YOUR GROUND is the true story of a cry for justice and of tragedy, trust and triumph. "Stand Your Ground" will put your faith on trial as the journey of Jackie Carpenter bridges the gap between Cell Block A and a miracle.
movies.simplePlot: A woman struggles with her faith when her son is falsely accused of murder and the odds are stacked against him.

biography.bio: Francine's career started in photography, modeling for national publications, traveling throughout in the Midwest, Toronto & Montreal. She began working in commercials & industrial training films, eventually booking roles on local Chicago productions, like Early Edition and Chicago Story, and playing opposite Tom Cruise in Risky Business. In the late 1990's, she took a 10 year sabbatical but came back to the career she loves in 2009, winning a Best Supporting Actress nomination at the 168 Project. Since that first nomination, she has also won Best Actress twice, once for her first self produced short Family Law, the other for True Tale Monsters, and she was again nominated Best Supporting Actress for "Breaking". Her first major starring role in a feature, was playing Jackie Carpenter in Georgia Justice (2012) She enjoys the freedom of traveling to various locations for film, having gone from Chicago to Seattle, LA, Charlotte, and even Poland in one year. She holds a degree in Criminal Justice from the University of Illinois.
biography.name: Francine Locke

biography.bio: The son of a pastor and music teacher, Drew was encouraged to perform in as many theatre productions as possible while growing up. He coupled that by studying piano, trumpet and guitar, all with a classical emphasis. After moving to several small towns in North Carolina that had no theatre programs, Drew set aside acting and started pursuing tennis. He eventually became a tennis professional after graduating from North Carolina State University. After teaching a tennis lesson to an actor, he was encouraged to go back and pursue his love of drama. He retired from tennis and has focused solely on Film and Television ever since.
biography.name: Drew Matthews

biography.bio: Cameron Arnett is an actor and producer, known for Meet the Browns (2009), Stand Your Ground (2013) and Star Trek: The Next Generation (1987).
biography.name: Cameron Arnett

biography.bio: Sandra Elise Williams was born on October 12, 1964 in Honolulu, Hawaii, USA. She is known for her work on The Notebook (2004), The Shunning (2011) and Stand Your Ground (2013).
biography.name: Sandra Elise Williams

biography.bio: Born in a small town in Alabama, Kelsi had her sights set on the big city. After receiving a ShowChoir scholarship to Jacksonville State University and attending nursing school, Kelsi packed up and headed for New York. She studied at the New York Conservatory for Dramatic Arts before being cast in her first independent feature film. It was on this set that she met her husband and fellow actor, Drew Matthews. She then moved to North Carolina where she continues work as a professional actress and teacher. In her free time, she enjoys family time with her husband and daughter.
biography.name: Kelsi Chandler

biography.bio: Darrel Ervin is an actor, known for Stand Your Ground (2013).
biography.name: Darrel Ervin

biography.bio: Will Ford is a native of Savannah, GA and a former U.S. Marine. Will was deployed with the First Marine Division during Desert Storm. He grew up at Bethesda Home for Boys in Savannah where his father, a United Methodist minister, had also been raised as an orphan. Will is of Native American, Scotch/Irish and German descent.
biography.name: Will Ford

biography.bio: Born in Atlanta, Georgia, Robert Thomason demonstrated an early interest in self-expression through drawing, creative writing, and performing in church productions and school musicals. While attending Buford High School, he also studied leadership training, debate, saxophone, and tennis. Robert's major changed in college from journalism to theater in pursuit of a strong desire to communicate both as an actor and designer. He landed his first lead role as Pippin at Georgia College. He also spent a summer working with the Lost Colony in Roanoke, North Carolina, America's longest running outdoor drama, written by Pulitzer Prize winning playwright, Paul Green. After graduating from the University of West Georgia with a Bachelor's degree in Speech and Theater, Robert worked as a freelance stage and lighting designer in addition to acting and directing dramas for several churches. After shelving his passion for acting and designing for a season of personal growth, Robert ultimately returned through the AMTC (Actors, Models, and Talent for Christ) on-camera training program. It was during this time that he performed for the award winning director and screenwriter, Michael McClendon, who soon cast Robert in his film debut principle role in the faith-based film "Stand Your Ground" (released in theaters 2014). This transition towards film also opened the doors for several independent film roles for him. In addition, Robert landed his first promo commercial for the cable station, Inspiration Networks, and voice over training narration for Chick-fil-A's corporate office. Robert resides in Atlanta, Georgia with his wife and their 4 children.
biography.name: Robert Thomason

biography.bio: Sherry Velvet Tatum is an actress, known for Stand Your Ground (2013).
biography.name: Sherry Velvet Tatum

biography.bio: Born and raised in the small town of Livingston, New Jersey. Studied Automotive Technology at a Vocational School in Cleveland, Ohio. Got bit by the acting bug in Atlanta. The story has just begun, and each page is written with care. From indie projects, to working as a picture car mechanic, to stunt work, to a range of acting roles, every piece has its place in the puzzle.
biography.name: Ronny Mathew

biography.bio: B.J. Arnett is known for her work on Stand Your Ground (2013), Grantham & Rose (2014) and The Marc Pease Experience (2009).
biography.name: B.J. Arnett

biography.bio: Greg D. Cochran is an actor, known for Stand Your Ground (2013).
biography.name: Greg D. Cochran

biography.bio: Lucia McBath is an actress, known for Stand Your Ground (2013), Imprisoned by Love (2013) and Forbidden (2012).
biography.name: Lucia McBath

biography.bio: Joivan Jimenez is an actor, known for Stand Your Ground (2013).
biography.name: Joivan Jimenez

biography.bio: Scott McDonald is an actor and producer, known for Stand Your Ground (2013), The Family Business (2013) and On My Way (2016).
biography.name: Scott McDonald
